API Reference¶

Client¶

Socket wrapper with busy channel tracking.

class src.client.SockedWrapper.SockedWrapper(host: str, port: int)[source]¶

Wraps a socket with enhanced functionality.

Provides: - Line-based reading - Busy channel tracking - Convenient encoding/decoding - Raw byte operations

busy() → bool[source]¶

Check if channel is currently busy.

readline()[source]¶

Read a line of text from the socket.

Returns:

Decoded string without trailing newline

Return type:

str

Note

  • Reads until newline character

  • Sets channel_busy flag during operation

  • Strips whitespace from result

recv(size: int)[source]¶

Receive data from the socket with busy state tracking.

Parameters:

size -- Maximum number of bytes to receive

Returns:

Received data

Return type:

bytes

send(data: str)[source]¶

Send string data (encoded to bytes).

Parameters:

data -- String to send

sendall(data: str)[source]¶

Send complete string data (encoded to bytes).

Parameters:

data -- String to send

sendraw(data: bytes)[source]¶

Send raw byte data without encoding.

Parameters:

data -- Bytes to send directly to socket

class src.client.Music_User.Music_User(socket: socket)[source]¶
do_exit(arg)[source]¶

Exit the application

do_login(arg)[source]¶

Login to the system: login <username> <password>

do_logout(arg)[source]¶

Logout from the system

do_registration(arg)[source]¶

Register new user: registration <username> <name> <password>

get_msg() → str[source]¶

Receive and return a message from the server.

Returns:

str

Return type:

Received message from server.

send_msg(message: str) → None[source]¶

Send a message to the server.

Parameters:

message (str) -- Message to send.

Database¶

File storage handler for music files in MP3 format.

class src.music_db.MusicFileDB.MusicFileDB(path_to_mp3='./music_db/data')[source]¶

Handles storage and retrieval of music files in a directory.

Provides methods for: - Checking file existence - Streaming music files - Writing new music files - Managing file operations

close_file()[source]¶

Close the currently open music file.

get_music(music_title, chunk_size=4096)[source]¶

Generate that yields chunks of a music file for streaming.

Parameters:

  • music_title -- Name of the music file to stream

  • chunk_size -- Size of data chunks to yield (default 4096)

Yields:

bytes -- Chunks of the music file data str: File size as first yielded value

Returns:

If requested file doesn't exist

Return type:

None

init_file(music_title)[source]¶

Initialize a new music file for writing.

Parameters:

music_title -- Name of the new music file (with .mp3 extension)

music_exist(music_title)[source]¶

Check if a music file exists in the database.

write_data(data)[source]¶

Write data to the currently open music file.

Parameters:

data -- Data to write to the file

Database handler for music application using MySQL.

class src.music_db.MusicSQLDB.MusicSQLDB(host: str, user: str, password: str, database: str, auth_plugin: str)[source]¶

Handles all database operations for the music application.

Manages connections to MySQL database and provides methods for: - User registration and authentication - Song management - Data retrieval

add_song(nickname: str, song_name: str, author: str) → bool[source]¶

Add a new song.

add_user(nickname: str, username: str, password: str) → bool[source]¶

Add a new user.

close()[source]¶

Close the database connection if it's open.

get_all_songs() → List[Tuple][source]¶

Retrieve all songs in the database with user information.

get_registered_users() → set[source]¶

Get set of all registered user nicknames.

get_user_songs(nickname: str) → List[Tuple][source]¶

Retrieve all songs belonging to a specific user.

update_registered_users() → None[source]¶

Update internal set of registered users from database.

verify_user(nickname: str, password: str) → bool[source]¶

Verify if provided credentials match a user in database.

Server¶

Command processor for handling music server operations and file management.

class src.server.ConectProcessor.ConectProcessor(musicSQL_db, musicFile_db, logged_users)[source]¶

Processes client commands and manages interactions.

close_file_conn()[source]¶

Close the current file connection and complete file operations.

async process_command(command, writer) → list[source]¶

Process incoming client commands and return appropriate responses.

Parameters:

  • command -- List of command components from client input

  • writer -- StreamWriter object for the client connection

Returns:

Response package containing either:

  • ["TEXT", response_string] for text responses

  • ["FILE", file_generator] for file transfers

  • ["GET", "FILE"] when expecting file upload

  • [] for empty/error responses

Return type:

list

write_to_file(data)[source]¶

Write data chunk to currently open file.

Parameters:

data -- Binary data chunk to write to file

Server for music platform.

class src.server.MusicServer.MusicServer(musicSql_db, musicFile_db, host='localhost', port=1337)[source]¶

Server for handling music requests and managing client connections.

async connection(reader, writer)[source]¶

Handle a new client connection.

Processes incoming commands from the client and manages the connection lifecycle.

Parameters:

  • reader -- StreamReader for incoming data

  • writer -- StreamWriter for outgoing data

async send_file(writer, file_generator)[source]¶

Stream a file to the connected user.

Parameters:

  • writer -- The StreamWriter object for the target user

  • file_generator -- Generator yielding file chunks

Returns:

None

async send_to_user(writer, message)[source]¶

Send a text message to a specific connected user.

Parameters:

  • writer -- The StreamWriter object for the target user

  • message -- The message string to send

Returns:

None

async start()[source]¶

Start the music server and begin accepting connections.

Initializes the server and message dispatcher, then enters the main serving loop.
